entry.et: Middle English dich, from Old English dīc dike, ditch; akin to Middle High German tīch pond, dike

def.dt: :a long narrow excavation dug in the earth (as for drainage)
:to make a forced landing of (an airplane) on water
:to get rid of :discard ditch an old car
:to end association with :leave ditched school his girlfriend ditched him
:a place of final defense or resort
:fought or conducted from the last ditch :waged with desperation or unyielding defiance put up a last–ditch resistance
:made as a final effort especially to avert disaster a last–ditch attempt to raise the money
